item.title: Chess
item.description: Development in chess is the process of getting your pieces into position for an offensive. ^580040 There is often a pattern to the development starting with your “minor” pieces like knights and bishops followed by “major” pieces like queen and rooks.

item.title: Compound interest
item.description: Looking for simple examples of principles to make them more tangible. Especially ones with smaller [[Feedback Loops]]. That way it is easier to learn them.

item.title: Feedback Loops
item.description: Domain expertise in people is built from having a lot of timely feedback and repetitions in their environment ^[[Feedback Loops#^21cc49]]

item.title: Personal Compass
item.description: A variety of principles and frameworks that have helped guide me. [[Regret Minimization]]

item.title: PIe Menu

item.title: Prompts
item.description: Provacative questions, thoughts, thinking starters to ponder https://twitter.com/esyudkowsky/status/1397561425774612484?s=21&t=s06sDcCWf4SIGW06icGFaQ

item.title: Regret Minimization
item.description: A framework for making big decisions. At the end of your life, you want to minimize the number of regrets you had in life.

item.title: Website
item.description: Would love if songs mentioned in these pages could be played in the background while people browse. Or maybe the music I listened to while I developed the wiki https://developers.

item.title: Wiki
item.description: A good wiki is a narrative factory. Every path of links that you take through it makes for an interesting story.
